etymologies: late 19th century: from modern Latin Aspergillus, from aspergillum, + -osis

definitions: a condition in which certain fungi infect the tissues. It most commonly affects the lungs, owing to inhalation of spores from moldy hay, and is then informally called farmer's lung.

notes.text: The fungi that cause this condition are blackish molds of the genus Aspergillus, phylum Ascomycota

shortDefinitions: condition in which certain fungi infect tissues
